Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: An introduction to the history of art emphasizing analysis and interpretation of visual art forms. The course will also focus on the functions and meaning of Western and non-Western art traditions. No credit for art majors.

Course Name: Art History I: Ancient and Medieval Art
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examination and interpretation of the major monuments of Western art and architecture from Paleolithic art to late Gothic art. The impact of non-Western traditions will be included as appropriate.

Course Name: Art History II: Renaissance to Modern Art
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Major movements and artists in painting, sculpture and allied arts of Europe and America from early Renaissance in Italy until the present day. The impact of non-Western traditions will be included as appropriate.

Course Name: Art of Africa, Oceania, and the Americas
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Stylistic and historical investigation of the art and architecture of the traditional societies of Africa, Oceania and the Americas within an art historical and cross-cultural perspective.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Painting, sculpture and allied arts in the United States and Europe from 1940 to the present.

Course Name: to the present. Prerequisite: ARTH 22007. Special fee: $45 flat fee—subject to change.42000 Research and Writing in Art History
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Introduction to the basic techniques and resources for art history research. Provides assistance in the preparation of research papers and critical essays required by upper-division art history courses. Corequisite: upper-division art history (ARTH) course.

Course Name: Arts of India and Southeast Asia
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examination of sources and styles of Indian and Southeast Asian art from prehistoric to modern.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examination of sources and styles of Chinese art from prehistoric to recent times.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examination of sources and styles of Japanese art from prehistoric to recent times.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Arts, crafts and architecture of the Western Sudanic and Guinea Coast areas of West Africa from prehistoric times to the present.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of the arts, crafts and architecture of Nigeria from prehistoric times to the present.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Comparative study of the arts, crafts and architecture of Central Africa from prehistoric times to the present.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: (Cross-listed with CLAS 41401) Greek art and architecture from earliest times through Hellenistic period with special attention given to recent archaeological discoveries.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: (Cross-listed with CLAS 41402) Introduction to archaeology of Roman world. Emphasis on discoveries and impact on study of Italic, Etruscan and Roman art, architecture and sculpture through Imperial period.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Emphasis on major period of Medieval art (Byzantine, Carolingian, Ottonian, Romanesque and Gothic), treating iconographic themes and styles in a variety of media.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: An examination of the development of European Gothic art from the 12th century to the 15th century. Emphasis on the ties to contemporary philosophical and literary developments. Prerequisites: ARTH 22006 and 22007.42041 Italian Renaissance Art (3)Study of development of major themes in Italian art from 1400 until c. 1550, emphasizing achievements of the masters and analyzing major ideas and theories of the period.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of development of major themes in Italian art from 1400 until c. 1550, emphasizing achievements of the masters and analyzing major ideas and theories of the period.

Course Name: until c. 1550, emphasizing achievements of the masters and analyzing major ideas and theories of the period. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing. Special fee: $45 flat fee—subject to change.42042 Northern Renaissance Art
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of stylistic and iconographic questions and technique in Northern panel painting, as well as other arts in Northern Europe.

Course Name: The High Renaissance and Mannerism in Italy
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Covers late 15th-and 16th-century painting, sculpture and architecture in Italy. Following discussion of the High Renaissance masters, students examine the works collectively known as the Mannerists. Course gives students a firm grounding in the manifold artistic activity of the 16th century.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Course provides a survey of Venetian painting, sculpture and architecture from the late 1300s to the late 1500s. Upon completion, students have a comprehension of the interrelationship of Venetian art with its unique environment and society.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of the origins of Baroque art in Italy and its spread throughout Flanders, the Netherlands, France and Spain.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of 18th-century art in France and subsequent spread and development throughout continental Europe.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Selected studies in late 18th-century and 19th-century British, French, German and Spanish art and architecture within the broader context of Western culture and ideas.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Intensive survey of the major forms of art, styles, personalities, patrons, institutions and aesthetic theories in the United States from its beginning to the Civil War.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: In-depth study of American painting, sculpture, graphic art, architecture and allied arts from the Civil War to 1940.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Investigation of photography from the 19th century to present day.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Study of painting, sculpture, architecture and allied arts in Europe from 1880 to 1940.

Course Name: to 1940. Prerequisite: ARTH 22007. Special fee: $45 flat fee—subject to change.42062 Picasso
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Course provides a survey of the art of Picasso, starting with his childhood works. Students gain a better understanding of Picasso’s pivotal importance to 20th-century art and the various influences that cultivated his incredible creativity.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examines the role of European roots in the formation of American art. The complex issues and identities artists faced as a result of the expatriate experience are addressed.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: A survey of major movements of the sixties decade, with primary emphasis on the United States.

Course Name: Gender and Sexuality in the Arts
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Examines how gender and sexuality correspond to a wide range of cultural meanings and experiences, and how artistic representations of gender and sexuality contribute to the production of subjectivity. Prerequisites: junior or senior standing.42070 History of Graphic Design (3)Traces the arts of visual communication from their origins to current trends and practices with an emphasis on theory and aesthetics.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Traces the arts of visual communication from their origins to current trends and practices with an emphasis on theory and aesthetics.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Chronological survey of printmaking (engraving, etching, lithography, etc.) from 1400 to the present, emphasizing its technical and stylistic evolution.

Course Name: to the present, emphasizing its technical and stylistic evolution. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing.42072 Introduction to Museology
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Art history course providing insights into the history of collecting, growth of museums and the scope of the museum field and specialized professional areas involved. Prerequisites: ARTH 12001 for nonart majors; ARTH 22006 and 22007 art majors.42075 Film and Photography in Western Art and Ideas (3)Selected studies on film and photography within the broader context of Western realism and ideas. ARTH 12001, 22007 or 42051 recommended.

Course Name: for nonart majors; ARTH 22006 and 22007 art majors.42075 Film and Photography in Western Art and Ideas
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Selected studies on film and photography within the broader context of Western realism and ideas. ARTH 12001, 22007 or 42051 recommended.

Course Name: or 42051 recommended. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing.42078 History of the Decorative and Applied Arts
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Historical and critical examination of decorative and applied arts and their relationship to the Western societies which produced them. Prerequisites: ARTH 22006 and 22007.42091 Art History Seminar (3)Open format course with topics announced in advance. Designed to allow detailed examination of selected topics. Prerequisites: junior standing and special approval of instructor.42092 Art Museum Internship (3)A supervised internship in a regional art museum emphasizing the practical application of museological principles and practices. Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Open format course with topics announced in advance. Designed to allow detailed examination of selected topics. Prerequisites: junior or senior standing and ARTH 42072.42095 Special Topics: Art History (1-3)Upper-division discussion and lecture course, whose content changes in accordance with the interest and competence of faculty. Precise title to be inserted in Schedule of Classes.

Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: A supervised internship in a regional art museum emphasizing the practical application of museological principles and practices. Prerequisites: junior or senior standing and ARTH 42072.42095 Special Topics: Art History (1-3)Upper-division discussion and lecture course, whose content changes in accordance with the interest and competence of faculty. Precise title to be inserted in Schedule of Classes.

Course Name: Special Topics: Art History (1-3)Upper-division discussion and lecture course, whose content changes in accordance with the interest and competence of faculty. Precise title to be inserted in Schedule of Classes. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing.42096 Individual Investigation: Art History
Prerequisites: major in art history (ARTH) or special approval of instructor
Description: Directed independent study with art history faculty. IP grade permissible.
